gurmukhi: mm qws Byd n koie ] sB lok jwnq soie ] iqn jwn hY krqwr ] sB lok Alok phwr ]38]
transliteration: Mam Taas Bhed Na Koe|| Sabh Lok Jaanat Soe|| Tin Jaan Hai Kartaar|| Sabh Lok Alok Pahaar||38||
translation: “There is no difference between me and him, all the people know this; the people consider him the creator of this and the next world and their destroyer.38.

gurmukhi: jb jb DrY bp soie ] jo jo prwkRm hoie ] so so kQO Abcwr ] sun lyhu bHm kumwr ]39]
transliteration: Jab Jab Ddarai Bap Soe|| Jo Jo Paraakram Hoe|| So So Kathau Abchaar|| Soun Lehu Brahm Koumaar||39||
translation: “Whenever we will assume the incarnations and whatever he will do. O Brahma! You may describe team.”39.

gurmukhi: su Dwir mwnuKI bpM sMBwr rwm jwig hY ] ibswr SsqR AsqRxM juJwr S`qR Bwig hY ]
transliteration: Su Ddaar(i) Maanoukhibapan Sanbhaar Raam Jaag(i) Hai|| Bisaar Shastra Astranan Jujhaar Shattra Bhaag(i) Hai||
translation: “you may assume the human form and take up the story of Ram; the enemies will run away, abandoning their arms and weapons, before the glory of Ram;

gurmukhi: ibcwr jOn jOn BXo suDwr srb BwKIXo ] hjwr ko n ikXo kroN ibcwr Sbd rwKIXo ]40]
transliteration: Bichaar Jaoun Jaoun Bhyo Sudhaar Sarab Bhaakheeyo|| Hazaar Ko Na Kiyo Daron Bichaar Shabad Raadheeyo||40||
translation: Whatever he will do, reform and describe them and inspire of the though of difficulties present the same in poetry arranging the thoughtful worlds.”40.

gurmukhi: icqwr bYx vwiksM ibcwr bwlmIk BXo ] juJwr rwmcMdR ko ibcwr cwr aucrXo ]
transliteration: Chitaar Hain Vaakisan Bichaar Baalmeek Bhyo|| Jujhaar Raamchcndra Ko Bichaar Chaar Oucdaryo||
translation: Obeying the saying of the Lord, Brahma assumed the form of Valmiki and manifested himself and he composed in poetry the actions performed by Ramchandra, the most powerful one;

gurmukhi: su spq kwNfxo kQXo ASkq lok huie rhXo ] auqwr cqR Awnno suDwr AYs kY khXo ]41]
transliteration: Su Sapat Kaandano Kathyo Ashakt Lok Hue Rahyo|| Outaar Chatra Aanano Sudhaar Ais Kai Kahyo||41||
translation: He composed in a reformed way the Ramayana, of seven Chapters for helpless people.41.
End of the description containing command for Brahma.
(Now being the description about Valmiki Incarnation)

gurmukhi: su Dwir Avqwr ko ibcwr dUj BwiK hY ] ibSyK cqRqwn ky AsyK sÍwd cwiK hY ]
transliteration: Su Ddaar(i) Avtaar Ko Bichaar Dooj Bhaakh(i) Hai|| Bishekh Chatrataan Ke Asekh Svaad Chaakh(i) Hai||
translation: After assuming the incarnation, Brahma, with the fullness of his heart and in a special way, presented his thoughts;

gurmukhi: AkrK dyv kwilkw AinrK Sbd aucro ] su bIn bIn kY bfy pRbIn ACR ko Dro ]1]
transliteration: Akarakh Dev Kaalikaa Anirakh Shabad Udaro|| Su Been Been Kai Bade Prabeen Achhra Ko Daro||1||
translation: He remembered the Lord and composed the songs and prepared the epic skillfully arranging the selected words.1.

gurmukhi: ibcwr Awid eISurI Apwr Sbdu rwKIAY ] icqwr kiRpw kwl kI ju cwhIAY su BwKIAY ]
transliteration: Bichaar Aadh Eeshuriapaar Shabad(u) Raakheeai|| Chitaar Kridaa Kaal Ki Ju Chaaheeai Su Bhaakheeai||
translation: For the divine thoughts, he created the word `Brahm` and by remembering the Lord and with His grace, he narrated whatever he wanted;
